Understand the advanced manufacturing pr: Understand the advanced manufacturing processes that ensure superior blade performance
Our shearing blades are manufactured fro: Our shearing blades are manufactured from carefully selected high-grade tool steels including Cr12MoV, 6CrW2Si, and SKD-11. Each material is chosen for its optimal balance of hardness, toughness, and wear resistance. Rigorous material certification ensures consistent quality and performance across all production batches.
Blades undergo controlled vacuum heat tr: Blades undergo controlled vacuum heat treatment to achieve optimal hardness of HRC 58-62. The process includes precise temperature control, quenching, and tempering to eliminate internal stress while maximizing edge retention. This advanced heat treatment ensures uniform hardness throughout the blade and superior dimensional stability.
Each cutting edge is precision ground us: Each cutting edge is precision ground using advanced CNC grinding equipment to tolerances of ±0.01mm. The four-edge design provides multiple cutting surfaces, extending blade life by 4x compared to single-edge blades. Flatness and parallelism are carefully controlled to ensure optimal cutting performance and minimal blade deflection.
Every blade undergoes rigorous inspectio: Every blade undergoes rigorous inspection including dimensional verification, hardness testing, edge straightness measurement, and surface finish analysis. Our quality control process ensures each blade meets or exceeds industry standards. Complete traceability documentation is provided with each order for quality assurance.

Common questions about shearing machine: Common questions about shearing machine blades
Blade life depends on material being cut: Blade life depends on material being cut, thickness, frequency of use, and maintenance. With four usable edges, our blades can last 4 times longer than single-edge blades. Typical service life ranges from tens of thousands to hundreds of thousands of cuts. Proper blade gap adjustment and regular rotation extend blade life significantly.
Our shearing blades can cut mild steel,: Our shearing blades can cut mild steel, stainless steel, aluminum, copper, brass, and other metal alloys. The maximum cutting thickness depends on material hardness and machine capacity. Standard blades handle materials up to 50mm thick in mild steel. For harder materials like stainless steel, specialized blade materials are recommended.
Signs include increased burring, rough c: Signs include increased burring, rough cut edges, visible nicks or chips in the cutting edge, increased cutting force required, or material deformation. When these occur, rotate the blade to use a fresh edge. Replace when all four edges show significant wear. Regular visual inspection after every shift helps maintain optimal cutting quality.
Blades with minor wear can sometimes be: Blades with minor wear can sometimes be professionally re-ground to restore cutting performance. However, deep nicks, cracks, or severe wear typically require replacement. Re-grinding reduces blade dimensions and may affect machine blade gap settings. We offer professional blade inspection services to determine if re-grinding is cost-effective for your situation.
For general mild steel cutting, Cr12MoV: For general mild steel cutting, Cr12MoV or 6CrW2Si provides excellent performance and value. For stainless steel and harder materials, consider high-speed steel (HSS) or tungsten carbide. For high-volume production, premium materials offer better long-term cost-effectiveness despite higher initial cost. Our technical team can recommend optimal materials based on your specific application.
Yes, we provide comprehensive installati: Yes, we provide comprehensive installation guidelines, blade gap adjustment procedures, and setup recommendations with every blade order. Our technical support team is available to assist with installation questions, troubleshooting, and optimization. On-site installation services are available for large orders or complex applications.
Get detailed material specifications, di: Get detailed material specifications, dimensional charts, hardness ratings, and application guidelines for our complete range of shearing machine blades. Download our comprehensive product catalog in PDF format.
